page.title: 01Gazeteer
page.content: The main centre of habitation on our grid is the village of Springholm, population approx.350, situated 6 miles northeast of Castle Douglas and 12 miles southwest of Dumfries on the busy A75 Euro-route from Stranraer (and Ireland) to Carlisle. Springholm was built in the early 1800's and at one time was served by a railway. Springholm's new primary school was opened in 1969 and presently has about 80 pupils. There are 2 small shops in the village, both general stores. A high proportion of Springholm's housing is council built but many of the houses have been bought by tenants. The remaining area of our grid is almost entirely farmland, used either for grazing or silage/hay. The terrain is gently rolling hills with only one stream, of any significance, Spottes Burn, part of River Urr.
